verbs.description: overplay (third-person singular simple present overplays, present participle overplaying, simple past and past participle overplayed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To overdo or overact one's effect or role.
examples: When Chris overacted his part again, the director warned that anyone overplaying would be barred from the next production.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To play (a song or record) too frequently.
examples: A lot of times I don't want to overplay songs that I really like, because I know that then I'll get sick of them and I don't want to get sick of them.

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To overestimate one's strength in a game or event, which ultimately may end in a defeat.
examples: Jack won the last match of blackjack; Theo overplayed.

entries.meaning: (transitive, golf) To accidentally hit (one's golf ball) beyond "the green".
examples: The first few shots went wonderfully, but Robin overplayed the last and lost.
